alert.note: Alert for Golden Valley; Judith Gap; Melville Foothills; Musselshell; Northeastern Yellowstone; Northern Big Horn; Northern Park; Northern Stillwater; Northern Sweet Grass; Southern Wheatland; Southwestern Yellowstone (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 16 at 11:00AM MST until January 18 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Billings
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY WILL EXPIRE AT 11 AM MST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations between 4 and 9 inches possible. Greatest amounts are expected to be north of I-90. * WHERE...Portions of central and south central Montana. * WHEN...From this evening through Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Roads will likely become snowpacked, slick and hazardous, with areas of poor visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Gusty southwest to west winds may cause local blowing and drifting snow today. Areas most likely to be affected include I-90 from Livingston to Big Timber, and US-191 from Big Timber to Harlowton. Visibility may be reduced to under 2 miles at times. Local rural roads may also see drifting. Drivers should use caution.
info.instruction: People may want to delay all travel if possible during the winter storm watch period. If travel is absolutely necessary, drive with extreme caution and be prepared for sudden changes in visibility. Keep track of the latest forecast updates.
